result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all fees and costs.
Follow all rules of the Department.
Counseling as deemed appropriate including COMPAS assessment and follow through with recommendations.  
Provide a DNA sample, if not previously submitted.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No possession of alcohol, drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
No entering any taverns/bars.

It is ordered that this appeal is dismissed and the time to file a Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30 postconviction motion is reinstated.

It is ordered that the motion for new counsel is denied. Appointed Counsel remains of record in this appeal.

It is Ordered that the motion for new counsel is denied.
It is further ordered that no later than July 16, 2021, Brian Flatoff shall file the response required by this order.  Flatoff shall provide a copy of his response to his appointed appellate counsel. If Flatoff does not respond to this court, appointed counsel will continue to represent Flatoff.
It is further ordered that is appeal remains stayed pending further order of this court.

PHASE 2 (12 person jury) - Case called 8:35 a.m.  Defendant appears in custody with Atty. Ben Szilagyi.  State appears by DDA Scott Ceman.  Record made re:  2 jury alternates.  Preliminary instructions read.  Opening statements.  Testimony taken.   State moves for a directed verdict.  Court denies State's motion for a directed verdict.  Jury instructions and special verdict reviewed outside the presence of the jury.  Stipulation as to State's Exhibit 3 to be released to DCI.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Jury instructions read to the Jury.  Closing arguments.  Bailiffs sworn.  Deliberation.  Special Verdict.  Court accepts verdict received on 03-09-18.  Def. adjudicated guilty on Counts 1 - 14.  Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation Report.

Def. appears in custody with Atty. Ben Szilagyi.  State appears by DDA Scott Ceman.  Day #5 of Jury Trial.  
Testimony taken.  Jury deliberates, verdict read.  Defendant found guilty on all counts (Counts 1 - 14).  Court legally retains verdict.  Defendant's bond is revoked.  Defendant to be held without bond.  Phase 2 of Jury Trial to begin Monday, March 12, 2018. at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 5.
PHASE 1
PHASE 1

Def. appears in custody.  Atty. Ben Szilagyi appears as standby counsel for Defendant.  State appears by DDA Scott Ceman.  Day #4 of Jury Trial.  
Def. requests Atty. Szilagyi take over as counsel for remainder of trial.  Court finds it had previously found that Def. had forfeited his right to have counsel.  Def. makes formal request for Public Defender representation.  State objects.  Court will address Def'.s request for public defender after lunch recess.  Testimony continues.  Lunch recess.  Court finds Def. waives right to represent himself.  Court orders Atty. Szilagyi to act as counsel for Mr. Flatoff at this time.

Defendant appears in custody.  Atty. Ben Szilagyi appears as standby counsel.  State appears by DDA Scott Ceman.  Court reaffirms Def. wishes to continue NGI pleas on all counts.  Review of jury selection process.  Proposed Jury Instructions reviewed.  Court's General Order #1 and General Order # 2 reviewed.  Court finds State's Exh. 1 and Exh. 2 will be allowed to be presented at trial.  Court does not allow media reports to come in during trial.  Court finds the State has complied with the Discovery Order.  Def. request for copies of depositions from civil case is denied.  Def. request for change of venue is denied.  Court denies Def. motion to suppress all evidence from the Neenah Police Department.  Court finds the Department of Justice investigation findings are not relevant to this case and will not come in at trial. State moves to strike all Def. requested witnesses as no offer of proof has been provided.  Def. to submit offer of proof for each requested witness on Monday, March 5, 2018.   Expectations of the flow of Jury Trial reviewed.

Def. appears in custody with Attys. Ben Szilagyi and Eric Heywood.  State appears by DDA Scott Ceman.  Def. Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Colloquy of Defendant as to waiver of right to counsel.  Court finds Def. waives right to counsel.  Court grants Def. Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Court orders Atty. Heywood and/or Atty. Szilagyi, or both, to remain as standby counsel.  Court also finds a forfeiture of representation by Defendant.  Arguments heard regarding Def. Motion to Dismiss - Destruction of Evidence.  Court denies Def. Motion to Dismiss - Destruction of Evidence.  Def. Motion to Suppress - Illegal Warrant withdrawn by Defendant.  Arguments heard and Court denies Def. Motion to Dismiss Count #6.  Def. Motion to Sever Charges (Counts #1, #2 and #12), Arguments heard.  Court grants Def. Motion to Sever Counts #1 and #2.  Count #12 remains as charged.  Arguments heard and Court ruled on Def. Motion in Limine.  Def. Motion Regarding Discovery heard.  Court orders standby counsel to assist Defendant in viewing videos.  Standby counsel Motion to Reconsider previous order of standby counsel.  Court denies Standby Motion for Reconsideration.  Recess (12:00 noon).  Case recalled 1:21 p.m.  Testimony taken regarding Def. Motion to Suppress Statement (filed Nov. 14, 2016) and arguments heard.  Court denies Def. Motion to Suppress Statement.  State's Motions in Limine heard. Court grants State's request to submit a certified record the Defendant was on bond at the time of these offenses and submit a certified copy of Judgment of Conviction showing Def. is a convicted felon.  State's Motion for Other Crimes Evidence (filed Nov. 18, 2016) heard.  The Court granted #1 and #3 and Court partially granted #2.  Defendant enters NGI plea.  Court orders examination to be filed with the Court within 21 days.  Defendant to file offer of proof regarding Def. Witness List within 7 days.  State to file Amended Jury Instructions within 7 days.  Based on the Court's severance order, the State motioned and then withdrew a motion to dismiss Counts 1 and 2.

Defendant appears in custody by video with Atty. Colleen Bradley by video and Atty. Angela Wang in person.  State appears by Deputy DA Scott Ceman.  Record made regarding Defendant's Waiver of Right to Be Physically Present at Preliminary Hearing.  State has no objection to Defendant's non-appearance.
